documentation.content:
## SQL Query Example

```sql
select supplier_name,city from (select * from suppliers join addresses on suppliers.address_id=addresses.id) as suppliers where supplier_id>500 order by supplier_name asc,city desc;
```

## SQL Standard Indentation Style Example

```sql
SELECT
  COUNT(a.column1),
  MAX(b.column2 + b.column3),
  b.column4 AS four
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      column1,
      column5
    FROM
      table1
  ) a
  JOIN table2 b ON a.column5 = b.column5
WHERE
  column6
  AND column7
GROUP BY column4
```

## Example SQL Code for Formatting Tests

```sql
SELECT
  supplier_name, city -- inline comment
  ,(select count(*) from people where supplier_id = s.id) as sup_count
FROM suppliers s left join addresses a on s.address_id=a.id
WHERE s.value>500 and a.city = 'New York'
ORDER BY supplier_name asc,city desc;

/* another comment in here */
INSERT INTO articles
(title, author, submission_date)
VALUES ('Learn SQL', 'John Doe', now());

UPDATE articles
SET author = 'Peter', submission_date = '2022-01-01'
WHERE title like '%by Peter';

CREATE TABLE articles (
  id int not null auto_increment,
  title varchar(100) not null,
  author varchar(40) not null,
  submission_date date,
  primary key ( id )
);
```

## Configure paramTypes for Positional and Named Placeholders

```javascript
{
  positional: true,
  numbered: [],
  named: [':', '@'],
}
```

## SQL Tabular Left Indentation Style Example

```sql
SELECT    COUNT(a.column1),
          MAX(b.column2 + b.column3),
          b.column4 AS four
FROM      (
          SELECT    column1,
                    column5
          FROM      table1
          ) a
JOIN      table2 b ON a.column5 = b.column5
WHERE     column6
AND       column7
GROUP BY  column4
```

## SQL Tabular Right Indentation Style Example

```sql
   SELECT COUNT(a.column1),
          MAX(b.column2 + b.column3),
          b.column4 AS four
     FROM (
             SELECT column1,
                    column5
               FROM table1
          ) a
     JOIN table2 b ON a.column5 = b.column5
    WHERE column6
      AND column7
 GROUP BY column4
```

## SQL Formatter CLI Configuration JSON Example

```json
{
  "language": "spark",
  "tabWidth": 2,
  "keywordCase": "upper",
  "linesBetweenQueries": 2
}
```

## Configure SQL Formatter Options in JavaScript

```javascript
format('SELECT * FROM tbl', {
  language: 'spark',
  tabWidth: 2,
  keywordCase: 'upper',
  linesBetweenQueries: 2,
});
```

## Define Custom Parameter Syntax with String.raw

```javascript
{
  custom: [
    {
      regex: String.raw`{[a-zA-Z0-9_]+}`,
    },
  ],
}
```

## PostgreSQL ALTER TABLE - Basic Table Modifications

```sql
ALTER TABLE [IF EXISTS] [ONLY] name ["*"]
  alter_table_action ["," ...]

ALTER TABLE ALL IN TABLESPACE name [OWNED BY role_name ["," ...]]
  SET TABLESPACE new_tablespace [NOWAIT]

alter_table_action:
    RENAME [ COLUMN ] column_name TO new_column_name
  | RENAME CONSTRAINT constraint_name TO new_constraint_name
  | RENAME TO new_name
  | SET SCHEMA new_schema
  | ATTACH PARTITION partition_name { FOR VALUES partition_bound_spec | DEFAULT }
  | DETACH PARTITION partition_name [ CONCURRENTLY | FINALIZE ]
```
